task.title: Configuring the server locale by using the GUI
task.shortdesc: System administrators can configure the geographic location and text formatting of the server logs by using the Server Locale, Date and Time page in the .

context.p: You can configure the server locale by using the , or by using the command line. For more information about using the command line to configure the server locale, see .

step.cmd: Go to the Server Locale, Date and Time page in one of the following ways:

choices.choice: From the Home tab, click Locale, Date and Time Settings in the Customize appliance settings pane.
From the Appliance menu, click Locale, Date and Time.

step.cmd: From the Server Locale and Timezone pane, choose an action:

choices.choice: To change the server locale, select a language from the Server locale list.
To change the time zone for the server, select a time zone from the Server time zone list.
